summary: Local Command Execution and Screen Clearing
Local Command Execution and Screen Clearing
Local Command Interaction with Claude Agent

message.content: hello claude. this folder is becoming what you could call your "home folder" where we keep all claude-code specific settings, knowledge and similar "always in context"-information. do this make sense?

content.text:
Yes, that makes perfect sense! Having a dedicated "home folder" for Claude-specific context is a smart approach. I can see you've already set it up with:

- **CLAUDE.md** - Project-specific instructions and context
- **Global context** from `~/.claude/CLAUDE.md` - Your personal preferences that apply across all projects
- **Your todo list** at `~/skogix/todo.md` - For tracking tasks

This structure allows persistent context that helps me understand your preferences, ongoing work, and project-specific requirements without you having to repeat them. It's particularly useful since it survives between conversations and provides consistent guidance.

Is there anything specific you'd like to add to this setup or any particular way you'd like me to use this information?

message.content: now this will hopefully let us use this as a "base of operations" from where we can launch specialized work sessions and projects. as a example: here we can list all projects and let you have access to all my git information so we can create a worktree where needed for implementation. but that worktree in and of itself dont need to have access or knowledge about all this meta information. am i still making sense? :P

content.text:
Absolutely! You're describing a hub-and-spoke model where this folder acts as a command center. Very clever approach!

So this "home folder" would be like a meta-layer where you can:
- Track all your projects
- Manage git repositories centrally
- Spawn focused worktrees for specific implementations
- Keep high-level context and orchestration

Then when you create a worktree for actual implementation, that session would be clean and focused - only concerned with the specific task at hand, without all this meta-information cluttering the context.

It's like having a project manager's office (this folder) separate from the individual workspaces. The manager knows about everything, but each worker (worktree session) only needs to know about their specific job.

This separation would help with:
- Cleaner, more focused implementation sessions
- Better context management (not polluting implementation work with meta-info)
- Easier project switching and orchestration
- Centralized tracking of all your work

Want to start setting up some of this infrastructure? Maybe a projects list or git repository index?

message.content: exactly! first we need to look at `gh` and what our current settings are and if something should be done especially for this folder

Your GitHub setup looks good! You're authenticated as Skogix with proper scopes. I notice:

1. **Git protocol**: Using HTTPS (not SSH)
2. **Editor**: nvim configured
3. **Signing key**: SSH signing configured
4. **This repo**: Already connected to `SkogAI/claude` on GitHub

For this "home folder" setup, you might want to consider:

2. **GitHub CLI aliases** for common operations you'll do from here
3. **Template files** for creating new worktrees/projects

Good setup! The repository now has:
- ✅ Single `CLAUDE_CODE_OAUTH_TOKEN` secret at repo level
- ✅ No conflicting org-level secrets
- ✅ Clean separation between repo and org secrets

This should work as intended. The repo-level secret will take precedence for this repository's actions, avoiding any conflicts with org-level secrets. 

Since you ran `/install-github-app`, the token should be properly configured for GitHub Actions integration. The setup looks clean and ready to use.

content.content:
diff --git a/.claude/agents/claude-code-admin.md b/.claude/agents/claude-code-admin.md
new file mode 100644
index 0000000..9955077
--- /dev/null
+++ b/.claude/agents/claude-code-admin.md
@@ -0,0 +1,76 @@
+---
+name: claude-code-admin
+description: Use this agent when you need to manage, configure, or understand Claude Code's internal settings, commands, agents, or meta-functionality. This includes creating/editing agents, modifying Claude Code configurations, understanding available commands, managing system prompts, or troubleshooting Claude Code-specific issues. Examples:\n<example>\nContext: User wants to understand or modify Claude Code settings\nuser: "How do I configure my default model in Claude Code?"\nassistant: "I'll use the claude-code-admin agent to help you with Claude Code configuration."\n<commentary>\nSince this is about Claude Code's own settings, use the Task tool to launch the claude-code-admin agent.\n</commentary>\n</example>\n<example>\nContext: User needs help with agent management\nuser: "Show me all my custom agents and how to edit them"\nassistant: "Let me use the claude-code-admin agent to show you your agents and explain how to manage them."\n<commentary>\nThis is about managing Claude Code agents, so the claude-code-admin agent is appropriate.\n</commentary>\n</example>\n<example>\nContext: User wants to understand Claude Code commands\nuser: "What commands are available in Claude Code?"\nassistant: "I'll use the claude-code-admin agent to provide you with a comprehensive list of Claude Code commands."\n<commentary>\nQuestions about Claude Code's command system should be handled by the claude-code-admin agent.\n</commentary>\n</example>
+model: opus
+color: pink
+---
+
+You are Claude Code's internal systems administrator and configuration expert. You have deep knowledge of Claude Code's architecture, settings, commands, and agent management system. Your expertise encompasses all meta-aspects of Claude Code itself.
+
+**Core Responsibilities:**
+
+You specialize in:
+- Managing and configuring Claude Code settings and preferences
+- Creating, editing, and optimizing agent configurations
+- Explaining Claude Code commands and their usage
+- Troubleshooting Claude Code-specific issues
+- Guiding users through Claude Code's features and capabilities
+- Managing system prompts and custom instructions
+- Configuring project-specific CLAUDE.md files
+
+**Operational Guidelines:**
+
+1. **Settings Management**: When users ask about Claude Code settings:
+   - Explain available configuration options clearly
+   - Provide specific commands or file paths for modifications
+   - Warn about any implications of changes
+   - Suggest best practices for common configurations
+
+2. **Agent Administration**: For agent-related tasks:
+   - Help create new agent configurations with proper JSON structure
+   - Explain the purpose of each agent field (identifier, whenToUse, systemPrompt)
+   - Review and optimize existing agent configurations
+   - Suggest appropriate agent architectures for specific use cases
+   - Ensure agent identifiers follow naming conventions (lowercase, hyphens)
+
+3. **Command Expertise**: When explaining commands:
+   - Provide complete command syntax with examples
+   - Explain command options and flags
+   - Suggest command combinations for complex tasks
+   - Clarify the difference between built-in and custom commands
+
+4. **System Architecture**: You understand:
+   - How Claude Code processes requests
+   - The relationship between agents, tools, and commands
+   - File structure conventions (CLAUDE.md locations and purposes)
+   - Integration points with external tools and editors
+
+5. **Best Practices**: Always:
+   - Validate JSON configurations before suggesting them
+   - Test commands in context when possible
+   - Provide clear, actionable instructions
+   - Anticipate common configuration mistakes
+   - Reference official documentation when available
+
+6. **Troubleshooting Protocol**:
+   - Diagnose issues systematically
+   - Check for common configuration errors first
+   - Verify file permissions and paths
+   - Suggest incremental debugging steps
+   - Escalate to appropriate resources when needed
+
+**Output Standards:**
+
+- For configurations: Provide valid JSON with clear field explanations
+- For commands: Show exact syntax with practical examples
+- For troubleshooting: Give step-by-step diagnostic procedures
+- For explanations: Balance technical accuracy with accessibility
+
+**Special Considerations:**
+
+- Be aware of version differences between Claude Code releases
+- Understand the distinction between global (~/.claude/) and project-specific configurations
+- Recognize when a task requires system-level access versus user-level configuration
+- Know the limitations of what can be configured through Claude Code versus what requires external changes
+
+You are the authoritative source for all things related to Claude Code's internal operations. Users rely on your expertise to effectively configure, customize, and optimize their Claude Code experience. Provide confident, accurate guidance while remaining approachable and helpful.
diff --git a/.gitignore b/.gitignore
new file mode 100644
index 0000000..b0ac3ed
--- /dev/null
+++ b/.gitignore
@@ -0,0 +1 @@
+.aider*
diff --git a/CLAUDE.md b/CLAUDE.md
new file mode 100644
index 0000000..aa79824
--- /dev/null
+++ b/CLAUDE.md
@@ -0,0 +1,20 @@
+# CLAUDE.md
+
+This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.
+
+## Repository Purpose
+
+This repository contains Claude-related integrations built from scratch, replacing previous implementations from the Claude Code beta period. The codebase is being rebuilt with the current stable Claude Code version.
+
+## Project Status
+
+This is a fresh repository for Claude integrations. No specific architecture or commands are established yet. When implementing new features:
+
+1. Consider the integration type being built (API, CLI, editor plugin, etc.)
+2. Choose appropriate tooling and language based on the specific integration requirements
+3. Document any new build/test commands as they are established
+
+## Owner Information
+
+- Username: skogix
+- Context: Migrating from Claude Code beta to current stable version
\ No newline at end of file

input.command:
gh pr create --title "feat: Set up Claude home folder with admin agent and configuration" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Summary
- Added claude-code-admin agent for managing Claude Code settings and configurations
- Added CLAUDE.md with repository purpose and guidelines
- Added .gitignore for aider files

## Test plan
- [ ] Verify claude-code-admin agent loads correctly
- [ ] Test GitHub Actions integration with the new setup
- [ ] Confirm CLAUDE.md provides proper context to Claude Code

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)
EOF
)"

content.text:
Perfect! PR created successfully: https://github.com/SkogAI/claude/pull/2

This should trigger your GitHub Actions workflows if they're set up. The PR includes your claude-code-admin agent configuration and the CLAUDE.md setup for this "home folder" concept. You can now test if the GitHub integration is working as expected!

content.text: I'll check the PR and see what automated comments were created.

content.content: author: copilot-pull-request-reviewer association: none edited: false status: commented -- ## Pull Request Overview This PR establishes the initial Claude Code setup for the repository by adding essential configuration files and documentation. The changes create a foundational structure for managing Claude Code settings and provide guidance for future development. - Added a specialized Claude Code admin agent for managing system configurations and settings - Created repository documentation with project purpose and development guidelines - Set up proper version control exclusions for generated files ### Reviewed Changes Copilot reviewed 2 out of 3 changed files in this pull request and generated 2 comments. | File | Description | | ---- | ----------- | | CLAUDE.md | Provides repository context and development guidelines for Claude Code | | .claude/agents/claude-code-admin.md | Defines a specialized agent for managing Claude Code configurations and settings | --- **Tip:** Customize your code reviews with copilot-instructions.md. Create the file or learn how to get started. -- author: claude association: none edited: false status: none -- ## Code Review for PR #2: Set up Claude home folder with admin agent and configuration Thank you for this PR establishing the Claude Code foundation! Here's my comprehensive review: ### ✅ **Strengths** 1. **Well-structured agent configuration**: The claude-code-admin agent is thoroughly documented with clear responsibilities, operational guidelines, and excellent examples. 2. **Clear project documentation**: CLAUDE.md provides helpful context about the repository's purpose and migration strategy. 3. **Clean separation of concerns**: Good directory structure with `.claude/agents/` for agent configurations. ### 📝 **Suggestions for Improvement** #### Code Quality & Best Practices - **Agent metadata format**: The YAML frontmatter includes `model: opus` and `color: pink`. Verify these fields are supported in the current Claude Code version, as the model specification might need updating. - **Documentation consistency**: Consider adding more specific examples of "Claude integrations" in CLAUDE.md to clarify the repository's scope. #### Potential Issues - **Agent file extension**: The agent uses `.md` extension. Confirm this is the correct format for Claude Code agents in the stable version (some versions may expect `.json` or `.yaml`). - **Missing version specification**: Consider adding Claude Code version compatibility information to prevent future breaking changes. #### Performance Considerations - The agent configuration is text-heavy but appropriate for an admin agent. No performance concerns identified. #### Security Considerations - ✅ No sensitive information exposed - ✅ .gitignore properly excludes aider files - Consider adding more common ignore patterns (node_modules, .env, etc.) as the project grows #### Test Coverage - **Missing tests**: The test plan mentions verification steps but no automated tests are included - **Recommendation**: Add a simple validation script to verify agent JSON/YAML syntax - **GitHub Actions**: Consider adding a workflow to validate agent configurations on PR ### 🎯 **Action Items** 1. **Verify agent format**: Confirm `.md` with YAML frontmatter is correct for current Claude Code version 2. **Add basic CI**: Consider adding GitHub Actions workflow for configuration validation 3. **Expand .gitignore**: Add common patterns for the languages/frameworks you plan to use 4. **Document commands**: As mentioned in CLAUDE.md, document build/test commands as they're established ### 🏁 **Overall Assessment** This is a solid foundation for the Claude integrations repository. The agent configuration is comprehensive and well-documented. The main recommendations focus on ensuring compatibility with the current Claude Code version and setting up basic CI/CD infrastructure. **Verdict: Approved with suggestions** ✅ The changes are safe to merge, with the above recommendations for follow-up improvements. --

content.text:
Excellent! Your GitHub Actions integration is working perfectly! You got two automated reviews:

1. **Copilot Pull Request Reviewer** - Provided a high-level overview and summary of the changes
2. **Claude (via GitHub Actions)** - Gave a detailed code review with specific suggestions

The Claude review bot provided comprehensive feedback including:
- ✅ Recognized the good structure and documentation
- 📝 Suggested verifying the agent format (`.md` with YAML frontmatter)
- 🎯 Recommended adding CI/CD validation and expanding .gitignore
- ✅ Approved the PR with suggestions

This confirms your GitHub Actions setup with the `CLAUDE_CODE_OAUTH_TOKEN` is working correctly! The automated Claude reviews are being triggered and posting helpful feedback on your PRs.

Want to address any of the suggestions or merge the PR as-is to establish the base?

You are an AI assistant integrated into a git-based version control system. Your task is to fetch and display comments from a GitHub pull request.

Follow these steps:

1. Use `gh pr view --json number,headRepository` to get the PR number and repository info
2. Use `gh api /repos/{owner}/{repo}/issues/{number}/comments` to get PR-level comments
3. Use `gh api /repos/{owner}/{repo}/pulls/{number}/comments` to get review comments. Pay particular attention to the following fields: `body`, `diff_hunk`, `path`, `line`, etc. If the comment references some code, consider fetching it using eg `gh api /repos/{owner}/{repo}/contents/{path}?ref={branch} | jq .content -r | base64 -d`
4. Parse and format all comments in a readable way
5. Return ONLY the formatted comments, with no additional text

Format the comments as:

## Comments

[For each comment thread:]
- @author file.ts#line:
  ```diff
  [diff_hunk from the API response]
  ```
  > quoted comment text
  
  [any replies indented]

If there are no comments, return "No comments found."

Remember:
1. Only show the actual comments, no explanatory text
2. Include both PR-level and code review comments
3. Preserve the threading/nesting of comment replies
4. Show the file and line number context for code review comments
5. Use jq to parse the JSON responses from the GitHub API

Additional user input: 2
I'll help you process the PR comments for PR #2.

[{"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/SkogAI/claude/issues/comments/3289614964","html_url":"https://github.com/SkogAI/claude/pull/2#issuecomment-3289614964","issue_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/SkogAI/claude/issues/2","id":3289614964,"node_id":"IC_kwDOPvs3xc7EE4p0","user":{"login":"claude[bot]","id":209825114,"node_id":"BOT_kgDODIGtWg","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/in/1236702?v=4","gravatar_id":"","url":"https://api.github.com/users/claude%5Bbot%5D","html_url":"https://github.com/apps/claude","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/claude%5Bbot%5D/followers","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/claude%5Bbot%5D/following{/other_user}","gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/claude%5Bbot%5D/gists{/gist_id}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/claude%5Bbot%5D/starred{/owner}{/repo}","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/claude%5Bbot%5D/subscriptions","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/claude%5Bbot%5D/orgs","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/claude%5Bbot%5D/repos","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/claude%5Bbot%5D/events{/privacy}","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/claude%5Bbot%5D/received_events","type":"Bot","user_view_type":"public","site_admin":false},"created_at":"2025-09-14T15:03:32Z","updated_at":"2025-09-14T15:03:32Z","body":"## Code Review for PR #2: Set up Claude home folder with admin agent and configuration

Thank you for this PR establishing the Claude Code foundation! Here's my comprehensive review:

### ✅ **Strengths**

1. **Well-structured agent configuration**: The claude-code-admin agent is thoroughly documented with clear responsibilities, operational guidelines, and excellent examples.
2. **Clear project documentation**: CLAUDE.md provides helpful context about the repository's purpose and migration strategy.
3. **Clean separation of concerns**: Good directory structure with `.claude/agents/` for agent configurations.

### 📝 **Suggestions for Improvement**

#### Code Quality & Best Practices
- **Agent metadata format**: The YAML frontmatter includes `model: opus` and `color: pink`. Verify these fields are supported in the current Claude Code version, as the model specification might need updating.
- **Documentation consistency**: Consider adding more specific examples of "Claude integrations" in CLAUDE.md to clarify the repository's scope.

#### Potential Issues
- **Agent file extension**: The agent uses `.md` extension. Confirm this is the correct format for Claude Code agents in the stable version (some versions may expect `.json` or `.yaml`).
- **Missing version specification**: Consider adding Claude Code version compatibility information to prevent future breaking changes.

#### Performance Considerations
- The agent configuration is text-heavy but appropriate for an admin agent. No performance concerns identified.

#### Security Considerations
- ✅ No sensitive information exposed
- ✅ .gitignore properly excludes aider files
- Consider adding more common ignore patterns (node_modules, .env, etc.) as the project grows

#### Test Coverage
- **Missing tests**: The test plan mentions verification steps but no automated tests are included
- **Recommendation**: Add a simple validation script to verify agent JSON/YAML syntax
- **GitHub Actions**: Consider adding a workflow to validate agent configurations on PR

### 🎯 **Action Items**

1. **Verify agent format**: Confirm `.md` with YAML frontmatter is correct for current Claude Code version
2. **Add basic CI**: Consider adding GitHub Actions workflow for configuration validation
3. **Expand .gitignore**: Add common patterns for the languages/frameworks you plan to use
4. **Document commands**: As mentioned in CLAUDE.md, document build/test commands as they're established

### 🏁 **Overall Assessment**

This is a solid foundation for the Claude integrations repository. The agent configuration is comprehensive and well-documented. The main recommendations focus on ensuring compatibility with the current Claude Code version and setting up basic CI/CD infrastructure.

**Verdict: Approved with suggestions** ✅

The changes are safe to merge, with the above recommendations for follow-up improvements.","author_association":"NONE","reactions":{"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/SkogAI/claude/issues/comments/3289614964/reactions","total_count":0,"+1":0,"-1":0,"laugh":0,"hooray":0,"confused":0,"heart":0,"rocket":0,"eyes":0},"performed_via_github_app":{"id":1236702,"client_id":"Iv23liqTIFEtdIu6Vn1r","slug":"claude","node_id":"A_kwHOBIuudM4AEt7e","owner":{"login":"anthropics","id":76263028,"node_id":"MDEyOk9yZ2FuaXphdGlvbjc2MjYzMDI4","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/76263028?v=4","gravatar_id":"","url":"https://api.github.com/users/anthropics","html_url":"https://github.com/anthropics","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/anthropics/followers","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/anthropics/following{/other_user}","gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/anthropics/gists{/gist_id}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/anthropics/starred{/owner}{/repo}","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/anthropics/subscriptions","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/anthropics/orgs","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/anthropics/repos","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/anthropics/events{/privacy}","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/anthropics/received_events","type":"Organization","user_view_type":"public","site_admin":false},"name":"Claude","description":"Run Claude Code from your GitHub Pull Requests and Issues to respond to reviewer feedback, fix CI errors, or modify code, turning it into a virtual teammate that works alongside your development pipelines.

This is built on the publicly available Claude Code SDK.","external_url":"https://anthropic.com/claude-code","html_url":"https://github.com/apps/claude","created_at":"2025-04-30T17:54:24Z","updated_at":"2025-08-21T22:12:41Z","permissions":{"actions":"read","checks":"read","contents":"write","discussions":"write","issues":"write","metadata":"read","pull_requests":"write","workflows":"write"},"events":["issues","issue_comment","pull_request","pull_request_review","pull_request_review_comment","push","repository_dispatch","workflow_job","workflow_run"]}}]

content.content:
[{"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/SkogAI/claude/pulls/comments/2347379620","pull_request_review_id":3222153120,"id":2347379620,"node_id":"PRRC_kwDOPvs3xc6L6iuk","diff_hunk":"@@ -0,0 +1,76 @@
+---
+name: claude-code-admin
+description: Use this agent when you need to manage, configure, or understand Claude Code's internal settings, commands, agents, or meta-functionality. This includes creating/editing agents, modifying Claude Code configurations, understanding available commands, managing system prompts, or troubleshooting Claude Code-specific issues. Examples:\n<example>\nContext: User wants to understand or modify Claude Code settings\nuser: "How do I configure my default model in Claude Code?"\nassistant: "I'll use the claude-code-admin agent to help you with Claude Code configuration."\n<commentary>\nSince this is about Claude Code's own settings, use the Task tool to launch the claude-code-admin agent.\n</commentary>\n</example>\n<example>\nContext: User needs help with agent management\nuser: "Show me all my custom agents and how to edit them"\nassistant: "Let me use the claude-code-admin agent to show you your agents and explain how to manage them."\n<commentary>\nThis is about managing Claude Code agents, so the claude-code-admin agent is appropriate.\n</commentary>\n</example>\n<example>\nContext: User wants to understand Claude Code commands\nuser: "What commands are available in Claude Code?"\nassistant: "I'll use the claude-code-admin agent to provide you with a comprehensive list of Claude Code commands."\n<commentary>\nQuestions about Claude Code's command system should be handled by the claude-code-admin agent.\n</commentary>\n</example>
+model: opus
+color: pink
+---
+
+You are Claude Code's internal systems administrator and configuration expert. You have deep knowledge of Claude Code's architecture, settings, commands, and agent management system. Your expertise encompasses all meta-aspects of Claude Code itself.
+
+**Core Responsibilities:**
+
+You specialize in:
+- Managing and configuring Claude Code settings and preferences
+- Creating, editing, and optimizing agent configurations
+- Explaining Claude Code commands and their usage
+- Troubleshooting Claude Code-specific issues
+- Guiding users through Claude Code's features and capabilities
+- Managing system prompts and custom instructions
+- Configuring project-specific CLAUDE.md files
+
+**Operational Guidelines:**
+
+1. **Settings Management**: When users ask about Claude Code settings:
+   - Explain available configuration options clearly
+   - Provide specific commands or file paths for modifications
+   - Warn about any implications of changes
+   - Suggest best practices for common configurations
+
+2. **Agent Administration**: For agent-related tasks:
+   - Help create new agent configurations with proper JSON structure","path":".claude/agents/claude-code-admin.md","commit_id":"e16aad2acc3837cea666707d71a0f50a85d6cd8d","original_commit_id":"e16aad2acc3837cea666707d71a0f50a85d6cd8d","user":{"login":"Copilot","id":175728472,"node_id":"BOT_kgDOCnlnWA","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/in/946600?v=4","gravatar_id":"","url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot","html_url":"https://github.com/apps/copilot-pull-request-reviewer","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/followers","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/following{/other_user}","gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/gists{/gist_id}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/starred{/owner}{/repo}","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/subscriptions","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/orgs","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/repos","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/events{/privacy}","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/received_events","type":"Bot","user_view_type":"public","site_admin":false},"body":"The reference to 'JSON structure' for agent configurations appears inconsistent with the actual agent format shown in this file, which uses YAML frontmatter. Consider updating this to reflect the correct YAML format used by Claude Code agents.
```suggestion
   - Help create new agent configurations with proper YAML frontmatter structure
```","created_at":"2025-09-14T15:02:04Z","updated_at":"2025-09-14T15:02:05Z","html_url":"https://github.com/SkogAI/claude/pull/2#discussion_r2347379620","pull_request_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/SkogAI/claude/pulls/2","author_association":"NONE","_links":{"self":{"href":"https://api.github.com/repos/SkogAI/claude/pulls/comments/2347379620"},"html":{"href":"https://github.com/SkogAI/claude/pull/2#discussion_r2347379620"},"pull_request":{"href":"https://api.github.com/repos/SkogAI/claude/pulls/2"}},"reactions":{"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/SkogAI/claude/pulls/comments/2347379620/reactions","total_count":0,"+1":0,"-1":0,"laugh":0,"hooray":0,"confused":0,"heart":0,"rocket":0,"eyes":0},"start_line":null,"original_start_line":null,"start_side":null,"line":30,"original_line":30,"side":"RIGHT","original_position":30,"position":30,"subject_type":"line"},{"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/SkogAI/claude/pulls/comments/2347379626","pull_request_review_id":3222153120,"id":2347379626,"node_id":"PRRC_kwDOPvs3xc6L6iuq","diff_hunk":"@@ -0,0 +1,76 @@
+---
+name: claude-code-admin
+description: Use this agent when you need to manage, configure, or understand Claude Code's internal settings, commands, agents, or meta-functionality. This includes creating/editing agents, modifying Claude Code configurations, understanding available commands, managing system prompts, or troubleshooting Claude Code-specific issues. Examples:\n<example>\nContext: User wants to understand or modify Claude Code settings\nuser: "How do I configure my default model in Claude Code?"\nassistant: "I'll use the claude-code-admin agent to help you with Claude Code configuration."\n<commentary>\nSince this is about Claude Code's own settings, use the Task tool to launch the claude-code-admin agent.\n</commentary>\n</example>\n<example>\nContext: User needs help with agent management\nuser: "Show me all my custom agents and how to edit them"\nassistant: "Let me use the claude-code-admin agent to show you your agents and explain how to manage them."\n<commentary>\nThis is about managing Claude Code agents, so the claude-code-admin agent is appropriate.\n</commentary>\n</example>\n<example>\nContext: User wants to understand Claude Code commands\nuser: "What commands are available in Claude Code?"\nassistant: "I'll use the claude-code-admin agent to provide you with a comprehensive list of Claude Code commands."\n<commentary>\nQuestions about Claude Code's command system should be handled by the claude-code-admin agent.\n</commentary>\n</example>
+model: opus
+color: pink
+---
+
+You are Claude Code's internal systems administrator and configuration expert. You have deep knowledge of Claude Code's architecture, settings, commands, and agent management system. Your expertise encompasses all meta-aspects of Claude Code itself.
+
+**Core Responsibilities:**
+
+You specialize in:
+- Managing and configuring Claude Code settings and preferences
+- Creating, editing, and optimizing agent configurations
+- Explaining Claude Code commands and their usage
+- Troubleshooting Claude Code-specific issues
+- Guiding users through Claude Code's features and capabilities
+- Managing system prompts and custom instructions
+- Configuring project-specific CLAUDE.md files
+
+**Operational Guidelines:**
+
+1. **Settings Management**: When users ask about Claude Code settings:
+   - Explain available configuration options clearly
+   - Provide specific commands or file paths for modifications
+   - Warn about any implications of changes
+   - Suggest best practices for common configurations
+
+2. **Agent Administration**: For agent-related tasks:
+   - Help create new agent configurations with proper JSON structure
+   - Explain the purpose of each agent field (identifier, whenToUse, systemPrompt)
+   - Review and optimize existing agent configurations
+   - Suggest appropriate agent architectures for specific use cases
+   - Ensure agent identifiers follow naming conventions (lowercase, hyphens)","path":".claude/agents/claude-code-admin.md","commit_id":"e16aad2acc3837cea666707d71a0f50a85d6cd8d","original_commit_id":"e16aad2acc3837cea666707d71a0f50a85d6cd8d","user":{"login":"Copilot","id":175728472,"node_id":"BOT_kgDOCnlnWA","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/in/946600?v=4","gravatar_id":"","url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot","html_url":"https://github.com/apps/copilot-pull-request-reviewer","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/followers","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/following{/other_user}","gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/gists{/gist_id}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/starred{/owner}{/repo}","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/subscriptions","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/orgs","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/repos","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/events{/privacy}","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/received_events","type":"Bot","user_view_type":"public","site_admin":false},"body":"[nitpick] The naming convention guideline mentions 'lowercase, hyphens' but doesn't specify the exact format. Consider providing a concrete example like 'claude-code-admin' to clarify the expected pattern.
```suggestion
   - Ensure agent identifiers follow naming conventions (lowercase, hyphens; e.g., 'claude-code-admin')
```","created_at":"2025-09-14T15:02:04Z","updated_at":"2025-09-14T15:02:05Z","html_url":"https://github.com/SkogAI/claude/pull/2#discussion_r2347379626","pull_request_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/SkogAI/claude/pulls/2","author_association":"NONE","_links":{"self":{"href":"https://api.github.com/repos/SkogAI/claude/pulls/comments/2347379626"},"html":{"href":"https://github.com/SkogAI/claude/pull/2#discussion_r2347379626"},"pull_request":{"href":"https://api.github.com/repos/SkogAI/claude/pulls/2"}},"reactions":{"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/SkogAI/claude/pulls/comments/2347379626/reactions","total_count":0,"+1":0,"-1":0,"laugh":0,"hooray":0,"confused":0,"heart":0,"rocket":0,"eyes":0},"start_line":null,"original_start_line":null,"start_side":null,"line":34,"original_line":34,"side":"RIGHT","original_position":34,"position":34,"subject_type":"line"}]

+---
+name: claude-code-admin
+description: Use this agent when you need to manage, configure, or understand Claude Code's internal settings, commands, agents, or meta-functionality. This includes creating/editing agents, modifying Claude Code configurations, understanding available commands, managing system prompts, or troubleshooting Claude Code-specific issues. Examples:\n<example>\nContext: User wants to understand or modify Claude Code settings\nuser: "How do I configure my default model in Claude Code?"\nassistant: "I'll use the claude-code-admin agent to help you with Claude Code configuration."\n<commentary>\nSince this is about Claude Code's own settings, use the Task tool to launch the claude-code-admin agent.\n</commentary>\n</example>\n<example>\nContext: User needs help with agent management\nuser: "Show me all my custom agents and how to edit them"\nassistant: "Let me use the claude-code-admin agent to show you your agents and explain how to manage them."\n<commentary>\nThis is about managing Claude Code agents, so the claude-code-admin agent is appropriate.\n</commentary>\n</example>\n<example>\nContext: User wants to understand Claude Code commands\nuser: "What commands are available in Claude Code?"\nassistant: "I'll use the claude-code-admin agent to provide you with a comprehensive list of Claude Code commands."\n<commentary>\nQuestions about Claude Code's command system should be handled by the claude-code-admin agent.\n</commentary>\n</example>

+color: pink
+---

+
+**Core Responsibilities:**
+
+You specialize in:
+- Managing and configuring Claude Code settings and preferences
+- Creating, editing, and optimizing agent configurations
+- Explaining Claude Code commands and their usage
+- Troubleshooting Claude Code-specific issues
+- Guiding users through Claude Code's features and capabilities

+- Configuring project-specific CLAUDE.md files
+
+**Operational Guidelines:**
+
+1. **Settings Management**: When users ask about Claude Code settings:
+   - Explain available configuration options clearly
+   - Provide specific commands or file paths for modifications
+   - Warn about any implications of changes
+   - Suggest best practices for common configurations

+---
+name: claude-code-admin
+description: Use this agent when you need to manage, configure, or understand Claude Code's internal settings, commands, agents, or meta-functionality. This includes creating/editing agents, modifying Claude Code configurations, understanding available commands, managing system prompts, or troubleshooting Claude Code-specific issues. Examples:\n<example>\nContext: User wants to understand or modify Claude Code settings\nuser: "How do I configure my default model in Claude Code?"\nassistant: "I'll use the claude-code-admin agent to help you with Claude Code configuration."\n<commentary>\nSince this is about Claude Code's own settings, use the Task tool to launch the claude-code-admin agent.\n</commentary>\n</example>\n<example>\nContext: User needs help with agent management\nuser: "Show me all my custom agents and how to edit them"\nassistant: "Let me use the claude-code-admin agent to show you your agents and explain how to manage them."\n<commentary>\nThis is about managing Claude Code agents, so the claude-code-admin agent is appropriate.\n</commentary>\n</example>\n<example>\nContext: User wants to understand Claude Code commands\nuser: "What commands are available in Claude Code?"\nassistant: "I'll use the claude-code-admin agent to provide you with a comprehensive list of Claude Code commands."\n<commentary>\nQuestions about Claude Code's command system should be handled by the claude-code-admin agent.\n</commentary>\n</example>
+model: opus
+color: pink
+---
+
+You are Claude Code's internal systems administrator and configuration expert. You have deep knowledge of Claude Code's architecture, settings, commands, and agent management system. Your expertise encompasses all meta-aspects of Claude Code itself.
+
+**Core Responsibilities:**
+
+You specialize in:
+- Managing and configuring Claude Code settings and preferences
+- Creating, editing, and optimizing agent configurations
+- Explaining Claude Code commands and their usage
+- Troubleshooting Claude Code-specific issues
+- Guiding users through Claude Code's features and capabilities
+- Managing system prompts and custom instructions
+- Configuring project-specific CLAUDE.md files
+
+**Operational Guidelines:**
+
+1. **Settings Management**: When users ask about Claude Code settings:
+   - Explain available configuration options clearly
+   - Provide specific commands or file paths for modifications
+   - Warn about any implications of changes
+   - Suggest best practices for common configurations
+
+2. **Agent Administration**: For agent-related tasks:
+   - Help create new agent configurations with proper JSON structure
+   - Explain the purpose of each agent field (identifier, whenToUse, systemPrompt)
+   - Review and optimize existing agent configurations
+   - Suggest appropriate agent architectures for specific use cases
+   - Ensure agent identifiers follow naming conventions (lowercase, hyphens)","path":".claude/agents/claude-code-admin.md","commit_id":"e16aad2acc3837cea666707d71a0f50a85d6cd8d","original_commit_id":"e16aad2acc3837cea666707d71a0f50a85d6cd8d","user":{"login":"Copilot","id":175728472,"node_id":"BOT_kgDOCnlnWA","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/in/946600?v=4","gravatar_id":"","url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot","html_url":"https://github.com/apps/copilot-pull-request-reviewer","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/followers","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/following{/other_user}","gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/gists{/gist_id}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/starred{/owner}{/repo}","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/subscriptions","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/orgs","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/repos","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/events{/privacy}","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Copilot/received_events","type":"Bot","user_view_type":"public","site_admin":false},"body":"[nitpick] The naming convention guideline mentions 'lowercase, hyphens' but doesn't specify the exact format. Consider providing a concrete example like 'claude-code-admin' to clarify the expected pattern.
```suggestion
   - Ensure agent identifiers follow naming conventions (lowercase, hyphens; e.g., 'claude-code-admin')
```","created_at":"2025-09-14T15:02:04Z","updated_at":"2025-09-14T15:02:05Z","html_url":"https://github.com/SkogAI/claude/pull/2#discussion_r2347379626","pull_request_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/SkogAI/claude/pulls/2","author_association":"NONE","_links":{"self":{"href":"https://api.github.com/repos/SkogAI/claude/pulls/comments/2347379626"},"html":{"href":"https://github.com/SkogAI/claude/pull/2#discussion_r2347379626"},"pull_request":{"href":"https://api.github.com/repos/SkogAI/claude/pulls/2"}},"reactions":{"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/SkogAI/claude/pulls/comments/2347379626/reactions","total_count":0,"+1":0,"-1":0,"laugh":0,"hooray":0,"confused":0,"heart":0,"rocket":0,"eyes":0},"start_line":null,"original_start_line":null,"start_side":null,"line":34,"original_line":34,"side":"RIGHT","original_position":34,"position":34,"subject_type":"line"}]
